solution_line_template: First, the weight of {num_cans} cans is {num_cans} cans * {weight_per_can} oz per can = <<{num_cans}*{weight_per_can}={weight_of_cans}>>{weight_of_cans} oz.
Thus, Jenny has the capacity to carry {total_capacity} oz - {weight_of_cans} oz = <<{total_capacity}-{weight_of_cans}={capacity_for_bottles}>>{capacity_for_bottles} oz of bottles.
Jenny can carry {capacity_for_bottles} oz / {weight_per_bottle} oz per bottle = <<{capacity_for_bottles}/{weight_per_bottle}={num_bottles}>>{num_bottles} bottles.
Jenny earns {num_bottles} bottles * {cents_per_bottle} cents per bottle = <<{num_bottles}*{cents_per_bottle}={earnings_bottles}>>{earnings_bottles} cents for the bottles.
Jenny earns {num_cans} cans * {cents_per_can} cents per can = <<{num_cans}*{cents_per_can}={earnings_cans}>>{earnings_cans} cents for the cans.
In total, she earns {earnings_bottles} cents + {earnings_cans} cents = <<{earnings_bottles}+{earnings_cans}={total_earnings}>>{total_earnings} cents.
